comment: Vause is the worse professor I've ever had. Facilitators are bad enough, but this man doesn't even know how to run D2L Brightspace. He started off the semester by grading discussions in a different way than stated in the syllabus and proceeded to trying to silently update it, not knowing it shows that it was change. No passion. Avoid at all costs.

Terrible. Wish I could rate him a 0. Second semester at KSU. Started the semester by changing the syllabus and not telling the class, then graded using the new syllabus, among other tricks. Absolute joke. Get ready to teach yourself this class if he returns.

Where do we begin- The 16 week semester didn't really start until week five. The class was online only and he sends out an email about a mandatory meeting that we have to attend while I am at work. I didn't have a single grade until week nine. If you ever get stuck trying to contact him he will depend on you to fix his course. Beyond disappointing.

Dont listen to the guy below me. They are just happy since Vause gave up and handed out 100s at the end. Sure he did not give up and die on the hill, that because he just gave up didnt show up on the hill. Still a terrible professor who shouldnt be employed at KSU and is a perfect example of the trash CYBR department

Easy class. It was his first time teaching and he may have picked up too many classes to start. The semester started off shaky but honestly the overall experience was good. Mr Vause is not the type to Die on this Hill so to speak, he adjusted and adapted as the semester went on. I believe this was a good learning experience for him going forward

Professor Vause spent over half of the semester trying to get the course going and then seemingly gave up. Haven't learned much about Data Comm's and Networking through this course. Had to resort to self teaching to get introduced to many of the important topics that will be built off of this class in future classes. Overall disappointed.

Absolutely nothing was taught to me. Did not seem to grasp some of the basics of teaching. Learned what the ping command is in a 4000 level networking class... Long turnaround to grade assignments. Was more inclined to talk about his past accomplishments than teach us/ set up the course.

I would avoid Mr. Vause at all costs. This was the most disorganized class I have ever experienced. Started class weeks late, constantly changing due dates, unclear assignments and harsh grading are all qualities this professor displayed. Impossible to contact and often pushed his obligations onto his students. Just a terrible experience all around

Professor Vause did not respond for the first 3 weeks of class and did not post any course material until the department got involved. Seems very disorganized. Once he got things together, we have few assignments, and they're not very difficult. He just expects you to read the book and pp slides. No other resources provided. He won't answer email.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: This professor severely lacks organizational skills and can't seem to keep up with his own course schedule. He frequently changes due dates and his grading is highly inconsistent. The coursework isn't too difficult once you find a Youtube channel to help you teach it to yourself, but keeping up with what is due and when will give you whiplash.

This is the worst course experience I have had in my entire life. He copied the syllabus and course content from another professor and can't figure out how to update it... in an IT class. He constantly changes deadlines and assignment expectations without warning. Grading isn't even a little consistent if he bothers to do it at all.

I don't actually believe this guy spends much time being a professor. Grading is completely random as if he just assigns random grades. Course had to be reset twice. This guy is completely unorganized and has no idea what he is doing and it hurts the students. The only upside is the course is recycled material from a previous professor who worked.

Literally hasn't taught anything, everything came from the book and slides which he didn't write and didn't make the quizzes or labs. Teaches a CYBR/IT class but barely knows how to use technology, failed to operate a livestream with a guest speaker and constantly messes up with due dates and submissions on d2l.

Don't take Professor Vause. He changes assignments the day before they are due with questions we havent learned and makes changes without telling. He says "All I have to do is teach y'all" when he hasnt taught us a single thing. We read a textbook he didnt write and slides he didnt make, no learning material actually comes from this professor.
